post.html:
1. Sets

1.1. Introduction

集合(set)：A set is an unordered collection of objects.

  • The objects in a set are call the 元素(elements)，or members, of the set.
  • A set is said to 包含(contain) its elements.
    • a∈Aa \in Aa∈A：aaa is the member of the set AAA.
    • a∉Aa \not\in Aa∈A：aaa is not the member of the set AAA.
  • 空集(empty set)：∅\varnothing∅.

集合的表示方式：The descriptions of a set

  • Roster method: listing all its members between braces, e.g. S={1,3,5,7,9}S=\{1,3,5,7,9\}S={1,3,5,7,9}.
  • Brace notation with ellipses: e.g. S={1,2,…,99}S=\{1,2,\ldots,99\}S={1,2,…,99}.
  • Specification using set builder: S={x∣P(x)}S=\{x\mid P(x)\}S={x∣P(x)}, which means SSS contains all the elements from UUU (Universal Set) which have the property PPP.
  • Venn diagrams

罗素悖论 Russell Paradox

Suppose there is a town with just one male barber; and that every man in the town keeps himself clean-shaven: some by shaving themselves, some by attending the barber. The barber obeys the following rule: he shaves all and only those men in town who do not shave themselves. Does the barber shave himself?

1.2. The relations between two sets

1.2.1. Subset

A⊆BA\subseteq BA⊆B: AAA is a 子集(subset) of the set BBB.

A⊆B⇔∀x(x∈A→x∈B)A \subseteq B \Leftrightarrow \forall x (x \in A \rightarrow x \in B)A⊆B⇔∀x(x∈A→x∈B)

1.2.2. Equal

A=BA=BA=B: AAA is 等于(equal) to BBB.

A=B⇔A⊆B∧B⊆AA=B \Leftrightarrow A \subseteq B \land B \subseteq AA=B⇔A⊆B∧B⊆A

1.2.3. Proper Subset

A⊂BA\subset BA⊂B: A is a 真子集(proper subset) of the set BBB.

A⊂B⇔A⊆B∧A≠B⇔∀x(x∈A→x∈B)∧∃(x∈B∧x∉A)A \subset B \Leftrightarrow A \subseteq B \land A \neq B \Leftrightarrow \forall x (x \in A \rightarrow x \in B) \land \exists (x \in B \land x\not\in A)A⊂B⇔A⊆B∧A=B⇔∀x(x∈A→x∈B)∧∃(x∈B∧x∈A)

1.2.4. The Size of Sets

TBD

1.2.5. Power Sets

Given a set S, the power set of S is the set of all subsets of the set S. P(x)\mathcal{P}(x)P(x) denotes the power set of SSS.

证明

P(A)∈P(B)⇒A∈B\mathcal{P}(A) \in \mathcal{P}(B) \Rightarrow A\in BP(A)∈P(B)⇒A∈B.

1.2.6. Cartesian Products

TBD

  • If ∣A∣=m, ∣B∣=n|A|=m,\ |B|=n∣A∣=m, ∣B∣=n, then ∣A×B∣=∣B×A∣=mn|A\times B|=|B\times A|=mn∣A×B∣=∣B×A∣=mn.
  • A×B≠B×AA\times B\neq B\times AA×B=B×A
  • A×∅=∅×A=∅A\times \varnothing = \varnothing \times A= \varnothingA×∅=∅×A=∅

1.2.7. Truth Sets of Quantifiers

Given a predicate PPP and a domain DDD. The truth set of PPP is PPP is the set of elements xxx in DDD for which P(x)P(x)P(x) is true. Namely, the power set of PPP is {x∈D∣P(x)}\{x \in D\mid P(x)\}{x∈D∣P(x)}

1.3. Set Operations

1.3.1. Union

A∪B={x∣x∈A∨x∈B}A\cup B = \{x \mid x \in A \lor x \in B\}A∪B={x∣x∈A∨x∈B}

1.3.2. Intersection

A∩B={x∣x∈A∧x∈B}A\cap B = \{x \mid x \in A \land x\in B\}A∩B={x∣x∈A∧x∈B}

1.3.3. Difference

A−B={x∣x∈A∧x∉B}A-B = \{x \mid x\in A \land x \not\in B\}A−B={x∣x∈A∧x∈B}: The difference of AAA and BBB.

1.3.4. Complement

A‾={x∣x∉A∧x∈U}\overline{A} = \{x \mid x \not\in A \land x\in U\}A={x∣x∈A∧x∈U}: A‾\overline{A}A is the 补集(complement) of the set AAA.

1.3.5. Symmetric difference

TBD

Ways to prove set identities

  • Show that A⊆BA\subseteq BA⊆B and that B⊆AB\subseteq AB⊆A.
  • Use logical equivalences to prove equivalent set definitions.
  • Use a membership table.
  • Use previously proven identities.

2. Functions

2.1. Introduction

TBD

  • AAA is called the 定义域(domain) of fff
  • BBB is called the 值域(codomain) of fff
